trans-unit.source: What is the Azure WebJobs SDK
trans-unit.target: What is the Azure WebJobs SDK

trans-unit.source: An introduction to the Azure WebJobs SDK. Explains what the SDK is, typical scenarios it is useful for, and code samples.
trans-unit.target: An introduction to the Azure WebJobs SDK. Explains what the SDK is, typical scenarios it is useful for, and code samples.

trans-unit.source: This article explains what the WebJobs SDK is, reviews some common scenarios it is useful for, and gives an overview of how you use it in your code.
trans-unit.target: This article explains what the WebJobs SDK is, reviews some common scenarios it is useful for, and gives an overview of how you use it in your code.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>WebJobs</linkText><title></title> is a feature of Azure App Service that enables you to run a program or script in the same context as a web app.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>WebJobs</linkText><title></title> is a feature of Azure App Service that enables you to run a program or script in the same context as a web app.

trans-unit.source: The purpose of the WebJobs SDK is to simplify the task of writing code that runs as a WebJob and works with Azure Storage queues, blobs, and tables, and Service Bus queues.
trans-unit.target: The purpose of the WebJobs SDK is to simplify the task of writing code that runs as a WebJob and works with Azure Storage queues, blobs, and tables, and Service Bus queues.

trans-unit.source: The WebJobs SDK includes the following components:
trans-unit.target: The WebJobs SDK includes the following components:

trans-unit.source: NuGet packages.
trans-unit.target: NuGet packages.

trans-unit.source: NuGet packages that you add to a Visual Studio Console Application project provide a framework your code uses to work with the Azure Storage service or Service Bus queues.
trans-unit.target: NuGet packages that you add to a Visual Studio Console Application project provide a framework your code uses to work with the Azure Storage service or Service Bus queues.

trans-unit.source: Dashboard.
trans-unit.target: Dashboard.

trans-unit.source: Part of the WebJobs SDK is included in Azure App Service and provides rich monitoring and diagnostics for programs that use the NuGet packages.
trans-unit.target: Part of the WebJobs SDK is included in Azure App Service and provides rich monitoring and diagnostics for programs that use the NuGet packages.

trans-unit.source: You don't have to write code to use these monitoring and diagnostics features.
trans-unit.target: You don't have to write code to use these monitoring and diagnostics features.

trans-unit.source: Here are some typical scenarios you can handle more easily with the Azure WebJobs SDK:
trans-unit.target: Here are some typical scenarios you can handle more easily with the Azure WebJobs SDK:

trans-unit.source: Image processing or other CPU-intensive work.
trans-unit.target: Image processing or other CPU-intensive work.

trans-unit.source: A common feature of websites is the ability to upload images or videos.
trans-unit.target: A common feature of websites is the ability to upload images or videos.

trans-unit.source: Often you want to manipulate the content after it's uploaded, but you don't want to make the user wait while you do that.
trans-unit.target: Often you want to manipulate the content after it's uploaded, but you don't want to make the user wait while you do that.

trans-unit.source: Queue processing.
trans-unit.target: Queue processing.

trans-unit.source: A common way for a web frontend to communicate with a backend service is to use queues.
trans-unit.target: A common way for a web frontend to communicate with a backend service is to use queues.

trans-unit.source: When the website needs to get work done, it pushes a message onto a queue.
trans-unit.target: When the website needs to get work done, it pushes a message onto a queue.

trans-unit.source: A backend service pulls messages from the queue and does the work.
trans-unit.target: A backend service pulls messages from the queue and does the work.

trans-unit.source: You could use queues for image processing: for example, after the user uploads a number of files, put the file names in a queue message to be picked up by the backend for processing.
trans-unit.target: You could use queues for image processing: for example, after the user uploads a number of files, put the file names in a queue message to be picked up by the backend for processing.

trans-unit.source: Or you could use queues to improve site responsiveness.
trans-unit.target: Or you could use queues to improve site responsiveness.

trans-unit.source: For example, instead of writing directly to a SQL database, write to a queue, tell the user you're done, and let the backend service handle high-latency relational database work.
trans-unit.target: For example, instead of writing directly to a SQL database, write to a queue, tell the user you're done, and let the backend service handle high-latency relational database work.

trans-unit.source: For an example of queue processing with image process, see the <linkText>WebJobs SDK Get Started tutorial</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For an example of queue processing with image process, see the <linkText>WebJobs SDK Get Started tutorial</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: RSS aggregation.
trans-unit.target: RSS aggregation.

trans-unit.source: If you have a site that maintains a list of RSS feeds, you could pull in all of the articles from the feeds in a background process.
trans-unit.target: If you have a site that maintains a list of RSS feeds, you could pull in all of the articles from the feeds in a background process.

trans-unit.source: File maintenance, such as aggregating or cleaning up log files.
trans-unit.target: File maintenance, such as aggregating or cleaning up log files.

trans-unit.source: You might have log files being created by several sites or for separate time spans which you want to combine in order to run analysis jobs on them.
trans-unit.target: You might have log files being created by several sites or for separate time spans which you want to combine in order to run analysis jobs on them.

trans-unit.source: Or you might want to schedule a task to run weekly to clean up old log files.
trans-unit.target: Or you might want to schedule a task to run weekly to clean up old log files.

trans-unit.source: Ingress into Azure Tables.
trans-unit.target: Ingress into Azure Tables.

trans-unit.source: You might have files stored and blobs and want to parse them and store the data in tables.
trans-unit.target: You might have files stored and blobs and want to parse them and store the data in tables.

trans-unit.source: The ingress function could be writing lots of rows (millions in some cases), and the WebJobs SDK makes it possible to implement this functionality easily.
trans-unit.target: The ingress function could be writing lots of rows (millions in some cases), and the WebJobs SDK makes it possible to implement this functionality easily.

trans-unit.source: The SDK also provides real-time monitoring of progress indicators such as the number of rows written in the table.
trans-unit.target: The SDK also provides real-time monitoring of progress indicators such as the number of rows written in the table.

trans-unit.source: Other long-running tasks that you want to run in a background thread, such as <linkText>sending emails</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Other long-running tasks that you want to run in a background thread, such as <linkText>sending emails</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: In many of these scenarios you may want to scale a web app to run on multiple VMs, which would run multiple WebJobs simultaneously.
trans-unit.target: In many of these scenarios you may want to scale a web app to run on multiple VMs, which would run multiple WebJobs simultaneously.

trans-unit.source: In some scenarios this could result in the same data getting processed multiple times, but this is not a problem when you use the built-in queue, blob, and Service Bus triggers of the WebJobs SDK.
trans-unit.target: In some scenarios this could result in the same data getting processed multiple times, but this is not a problem when you use the built-in queue, blob, and Service Bus triggers of the WebJobs SDK.

trans-unit.source: The SDK ensures that your functions will be processed only once for each message or blob.
trans-unit.target: The SDK ensures that your functions will be processed only once for each message or blob.

trans-unit.source: The code for handling typical tasks that work with Azure Storage is simple.
trans-unit.target: The code for handling typical tasks that work with Azure Storage is simple.

trans-unit.source: In a Console Application, you write methods for the background tasks that you want to execute, and you decorate them with attributes from the WebJobs SDK.
trans-unit.target: In a Console Application, you write methods for the background tasks that you want to execute, and you decorate them with attributes from the WebJobs SDK.

trans-unit.source: Your Main method creates a JobHost object that coordinates the calls to methods you write.
trans-unit.target: Your Main method creates a JobHost object that coordinates the calls to methods you write.

trans-unit.source: The WebJobs SDK framework knows when to call your methods based on the WebJobs SDK attributes you use in them.
trans-unit.target: The WebJobs SDK framework knows when to call your methods based on the WebJobs SDK attributes you use in them.

trans-unit.source: Here is a simple program that polls a queue and creates a blob for each queue message received:
trans-unit.target: Here is a simple program that polls a queue and creates a blob for each queue message received:

trans-unit.source: The JobHost object is a container for a set of background functions.
trans-unit.target: The JobHost object is a container for a set of background functions.

trans-unit.source: The JobHost object monitors the functions, watches for events that trigger them, and executes the functions when trigger events occur.
trans-unit.target: The JobHost object monitors the functions, watches for events that trigger them, and executes the functions when trigger events occur.

trans-unit.source: You call a JobHost method to indicate whether you want the container process to run on the current thread or a background thread.
trans-unit.target: You call a JobHost method to indicate whether you want the container process to run on the current thread or a background thread.

trans-unit.source: In the example, the RunAndBlock method runs the process continuously on the current thread.
trans-unit.target: In the example, the RunAndBlock method runs the process continuously on the current thread.

trans-unit.source: Because the ProcessQueueMessage method in this example has a QueueTrigger attribute, the trigger for that function is the reception of a new queue message.
trans-unit.target: Because the ProcessQueueMessage method in this example has a QueueTrigger attribute, the trigger for that function is the reception of a new queue message.

trans-unit.source: The JobHost object watches for new queue messages on the specified queue ("webjobsqueue" in this sample) and when one is found, it calls ProcessQueueMessage.
trans-unit.target: The JobHost object watches for new queue messages on the specified queue ("webjobsqueue" in this sample) and when one is found, it calls ProcessQueueMessage.

trans-unit.source: The QueueTrigger attribute binds the inputText parameter to the value of the queue message.
trans-unit.target: The QueueTrigger attribute binds the inputText parameter to the value of the queue message.

trans-unit.source: And the Blob attribute binds a TextWriter object to a blob named "blobname" in a container named "containername".
trans-unit.target: And the Blob attribute binds a TextWriter object to a blob named "blobname" in a container named "containername".

trans-unit.source: The function then uses these parameters to write the value of the queue message to the blob:
trans-unit.target: The function then uses these parameters to write the value of the queue message to the blob:

trans-unit.source: The trigger and binder features of the WebJobs SDK greatly simplify the code you have to write to work with Azure Storage and Service Bus queues.
trans-unit.target: The trigger and binder features of the WebJobs SDK greatly simplify the code you have to write to work with Azure Storage and Service Bus queues.

trans-unit.source: The low-level code required to handle queue and blob processing is done for you by the WebJobs SDK framework -- the framework creates queues that don't exist yet, opens the queue, reads queue messages, deletes queue messages when processing is completed, creates blob containers that don't exist yet, writes to blobs, and so on.
trans-unit.target: The low-level code required to handle queue and blob processing is done for you by the WebJobs SDK framework -- the framework creates queues that don't exist yet, opens the queue, reads queue messages, deletes queue messages when processing is completed, creates blob containers that don't exist yet, writes to blobs, and so on.

trans-unit.source: The WebJobs SDK provides many ways to work with Azure Storage.
trans-unit.target: The WebJobs SDK provides many ways to work with Azure Storage.

trans-unit.source: For example, if the parameter you decorate with the QueueTrigger attribute is a byte array or a custom type, it is automatically deserialized from JSON.
trans-unit.target: For example, if the parameter you decorate with the QueueTrigger attribute is a byte array or a custom type, it is automatically deserialized from JSON.

trans-unit.source: And you can use a BlobTrigger attribute to trigger a process whenever a new blob is created in an Azure Storage account.
trans-unit.target: And you can use a BlobTrigger attribute to trigger a process whenever a new blob is created in an Azure Storage account.

trans-unit.source: (Note that while QueueTrigger finds new queue messages within a few seconds, BlobTrigger can take up to 20 minutes to detect a new blob.
trans-unit.target: (Note that while QueueTrigger finds new queue messages within a few seconds, BlobTrigger can take up to 20 minutes to detect a new blob.

trans-unit.source: BlobTrigger scans for blobs whenever the JobHost starts and then periodically checks the Azure Storage logs to detect new blobs.)
trans-unit.target: BlobTrigger scans for blobs whenever the JobHost starts and then periodically checks the Azure Storage logs to detect new blobs.)

trans-unit.source: A program that uses the the WebJobs SDK is a standard Console Application and can run anywhere -- it doesn't have to run as a WebJob.
trans-unit.target: A program that uses the the WebJobs SDK is a standard Console Application and can run anywhere -- it doesn't have to run as a WebJob.

trans-unit.source: You can test the program locally on your development computer, and in production you can run it in a Cloud Service worker role or a Windows service if you prefer one of those environments.
trans-unit.target: You can test the program locally on your development computer, and in production you can run it in a Cloud Service worker role or a Windows service if you prefer one of those environments.

trans-unit.source: However, the dashboard is only available as an extension for an Azure App Service web app.
trans-unit.target: However, the dashboard is only available as an extension for an Azure App Service web app.

trans-unit.source: If you want to run outside of a WebJob and still use the Dashboard, you can configure a web app to use the same storage account that your WebJobs SDK Dashboard connection string refers to, and that web app's WebJobs Dashboard will then show data about function execution from your program that is running somewhere else.
trans-unit.target: If you want to run outside of a WebJob and still use the Dashboard, you can configure a web app to use the same storage account that your WebJobs SDK Dashboard connection string refers to, and that web app's WebJobs Dashboard will then show data about function execution from your program that is running somewhere else.

trans-unit.source: You can get to the Dashboard by using the URL https://{webappname}.scm.azurewebsites.net/azurejobs/#/functions.
trans-unit.target: You can get to the Dashboard by using the URL https://{webappname}.scm.azurewebsites.net/azurejobs/#/functions.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <linkText>Getting a dashboard for local development with the WebJobs SDK</linkText><title></title>, but note that the blog post shows an old connection string name.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <linkText>Getting a dashboard for local development with the WebJobs SDK</linkText><title></title>, but note that the blog post shows an old connection string name.

trans-unit.source: The WebJobs SDK provides several advantages even if you don't need to work directly with Azure Storage queues, tables, or blobs, or Service Bus queues:
trans-unit.target: The WebJobs SDK provides several advantages even if you don't need to work directly with Azure Storage queues, tables, or blobs, or Service Bus queues:

trans-unit.source: You can invoke functions from the Dashboard.
trans-unit.target: You can invoke functions from the Dashboard.

trans-unit.source: You can replay functions from the Dashboard.
trans-unit.target: You can replay functions from the Dashboard.

trans-unit.source: You can view logs in the Dashboard, linked to the particular WebJob (application logs, written by using Console.Out, Console.Error, Trace, etc.)
trans-unit.target: You can view logs in the Dashboard, linked to the particular WebJob (application logs, written by using Console.Out, Console.Error, Trace, etc.)

trans-unit.source: or linked to the particular function invocation that generated them (logs written by using a TextWriter object that the SDK passes to the function as a parameter).
trans-unit.target: or linked to the particular function invocation that generated them (logs written by using a TextWriter object that the SDK passes to the function as a parameter).

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <linkText>How to manually invoke a function</linkText><title></title> and <linkText>How to write logs</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <linkText>How to manually invoke a function</linkText><title></title> and <linkText>How to write logs</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: For more information about the WebJobs SDK, see <linkText>Azure WebJobs Recommended Resources</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about the WebJobs SDK, see <linkText>Azure WebJobs Recommended Resources</linkText><title></title>.
